meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a book.
meanings.sent1: The old library had a booky smell of dusty pages and leather bindings.
meanings.sent2: Her booky glasses and love for reading made her the perfect candidate for the book club.
meanings.sent3: The booky cover of the novel seemed to whisper secrets to anyone who dared to open it.
meanings.sent4: The booky atmosphere of the bookstore enveloped her like a warm literary hug.
meanings.sent5: The booky texture of the paper made her fingertips tingle with anticipation.

meanings.definition: Tending to read or collect books.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the booky kid in school because he always had a novel in hand.
meanings.sent2: Her booky habits led her to amass a collection of rare first editions.
meanings.sent3: The booky enthusiast spent hours browsing through the shelves of the bookstore.
meanings.sent4: Her booky nature made her the go-to person for book recommendations.
meanings.sent5: The booky passion in her eyes was evident whenever she talked about her favorite authors.

meanings.definition: Suspicious or untrustworthy in a way that suggests a plot or story.
meanings.sent1: The stranger's booky behavior made her uneasy as he lurked around the bookstore.
meanings.sent2: His booky smile and shifty eyes raised red flags for the detective.
meanings.sent3: The booky character in the mystery novel turned out to be the least expected suspect.
meanings.sent4: The booky plot thickened as more clues pointed towards the librarian's involvement.
meanings.sent5: The booky aura surrounding the antique book seemed to hold a dark secret within its pages.
